title: fanoutqa: Find the players that have retired numbers at Miami Heat. Who are these players and what are their career points? (43c8c96b55ba2d48)

<document>
<title>Miami Heat all-time roster</title>
<fragment>

| †

</fragment>
<fragment>
18. **^** "Ray Allen". *hoophall.com*. Retrieved January 19, 2022.
19. **^** "Chris Bosh Selected To Basketball Hall of Fame". *nba.com*. Retrieved January 19, 2022.
20. **^** "Wade flushes Heat's scoring mark". ESPN Internet Ventures. March 19, 2009. Retrieved February 4, 2012.
21. **^** "Durant, Thunder spoil record breaking night by Wade". *The Sports Network*. Bell Media. January 16, 2010. Retrieved February 4, 2012.
22. **^** "Miami Heat Career Leaders". *basketball-reference.com*. Archived from the original on March 31, 2012. Retrieved January 31, 2012.
23. **^** "Heat retires first number". *Sports Illustrated*. April 11, 2003. Retrieved January 30, 2012.
24. **^** Mahoney, Brian (November 14, 2009). "Leaguewide retirement of No. 23 seems unlikely". *USA Today*. Retrieved January 30, 2012.
25. **^** "Heat retire Mourning's No. 33". ESPN Internet Ventures. March 31, 2009. Retrieved January 30, 2012.

</fragment>
<fragment>
Udonis Haslem, who has played for the Heat since he entered the league in 2003, is the franchise's longest-serving player. Haslem has recorded more rebounds than any other Heat players. Wade has played more games, more minutes, scored more points, recorded more assists and more steals than any other Heat players.[20][21] He also led the franchise in field goals made and free throws made.[22] Mourning, who played 11 seasons with the Heat, is the franchise's third longest-serving player. He has blocked more shots than any other Heat players. The Heat have six retired jersey numbers: the number 3 worn by Dwyane Wade, the number 33 jersey worn by Alonzo Mourning, the number 10 jersey worn by Tim Hardaway, the number 1 jersey worn by Chris Bosh, the number 23 jersey worn by Michael Jordan, who has never played for the Heat and the number 32 jersey worn by Shaquille O'Neal. 
</fragment>
<fragment>

* **a** Players can sometimes be assigned more than one jersey number.
* **b** Each year is linked to an article about that particular NBA season.
* **c** Only includes achievements as Heat players.


## References[edit]


General
* "All-Time Heat Roster". *NBA.com*. Turner Sports Interactive, Inc. November 1, 2010. Retrieved January 3, 2012.
* "Miami Heat Media Guide 2010–2011" (PDF). *NBA.com*. Turner Sports Interactive, Inc. Archived from the original (PDF) on January 8, 2014. Retrieved December 31, 2011.
* "Miami Heat Players". *basketball-reference.com*. Retrieved June 26, 2012.
* "Miami Heat Career Leaders". *basketball-reference.com*. Retrieved June 26, 2012.
* "Miami Heat Players – Playoffs Statistics". *basketball-reference.com*. Retrieved June 26, 2012.


</fragment>
<fragment>
The Heat retired Jordan's number 23 jersey in April 2003 to honor Jordan's achievements and contributions in basketball.[23] The Heat are the only NBA team other than the Chicago Bulls to have retired the number 23 jersey in honor of Jordan.[24] Mourning had his number 33 jersey retired in March 2009, a year after he retired.[25] Hardaway, who played six seasons with the Heat, had his number 10 jersey retired in October 2009.[26]

## List[edit]




</fragment>
<fragment>

![](image)All-Star forward Chris Bosh joined the Heat in 2010.
![](image)Mario Chalmers was the Heat starting point guard in two of their championship-winning seasons.
![](image)Udonis Haslem is the team's longest-serving player.
![](image)LeBron James won the NBA Most Valuable Player Award in 2012 and 2013.
![](image)Eddie Jones played six seasons with the Heat in two separate stints.
![](image)Alonzo Mourning, who had his number 33 jersey retired by the Heat, is the team's third longest-serving player.
![](image)Shaquille O'Neal played four seasons with the Heat from 2004 to 2008.
![](image)Gary Payton is the first Heat player to be inducted to the Basketball Hall of Fame.
![](image)Glen Rice played six seasons with the Heat since he was drafted fourth in 1989.
![](image)Dwyane Wade is one of the team's longest-serving players and also the most successful player in franchise history.
![](image)Jason Williams was the Heat starting point guard for three seasons.


</fragment>

<fragment>
and Bam Adebayo are the only other Heat players who have been selected to the All-Star Game.[13][14] Two Heat players have won the NBA Most Improved Player Award: Rony Seikaly in 1990 and Isaac Austin in 1997.[15][16] Ten Heat players were selected to the All-Rookie Team. Mourning, Shaquille O'Neal and Gary Payton, who played two seasons for the Heat and was part of the Heat championship team in 2006, have been inducted to the Basketball Hall of Fame. [17] Ray Allen was inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame in 2018,[18] while Chris Bosh was inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame in 2021.[19]

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
